title: Restore PDF Vaulty to Version 29 (Pre-PowerPoint Deployment)

requirements.text: Restore the application to Version 29 state, which was the last stable deployment before Version 30 and 31 failed. This version should include all core PDF tools (merge, split, compress, rotate, protect, Word to PDF, Excel to PDF, Image to PDF) but exclude the PowerPoint to PDF feature that caused deployment issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Application deploys successfully to a working canister with a valid URL
All existing PDF tools function correctly (merge, split, compress, rotate, protect, convert)
PowerPoint to PDF feature is removed from the conversion tools page
PowerPoint to PDF route is removed from the router configuration
User authentication and file management features work properly
AdSense monetization and traffic counter remain functional
Application is accessible at a stable URL without 'Canister ID Not Resolved' errors

requirements.text: Remove all PowerPoint to PDF conversion functionality from the codebase, including the PowerPointToPdfPage component, powerPointToPdf utility function, and related routes, since this feature caused the deployment failures in versions 30 and 31.
acceptanceCriteria: PowerPointToPdfPage.tsx is removed or excluded from the build
powerPointToPdf.ts utility is removed or excluded from the build
PowerPoint option is removed from the ConvertIntoPdfPage tool grid
No PowerPoint-related routes exist in App.tsx router configuration
Application builds and deploys without PowerPoint dependencies

requirements.text: Ensure the deployed application is accessible at the pdfvaulty-url.caffeine.xyz domain shown in the user's screenshots, with proper canister deployment that resolves without errors.
acceptanceCriteria: Application deploys to a valid canister ID on the Internet Computer
The pdfvaulty-url.caffeine.xyz domain properly resolves to the deployed canister
Homepage loads without 'Publish or restore your Caffeine app' message
No 'Canister ID Not Resolved' errors occur when accessing the site

constraints: Must not include PowerPoint to PDF conversion feature that caused versions 30 and 31 to fail
Must maintain all other existing features including authentication, file management, AdSense monetization, and traffic analytics
Backend schema and state management must remain unchanged from previous working versions
nonGoals: Adding new features or tools beyond what existed in Version 29
Modifying the backend actor structure or data models
Changing the visual design or UI styling
Connecting custom domain pdf-vaulty.com (deployment stability is priority)
